content.description: A good but short finger crack.
content.protection: gear to 1"- 2". 2 bolts and rap anchor. Small cams for the crux finger crack.
content.location: far right side of DuJour area, off by itself, you will see the splitter crack angling left above some blocky climbing.

content.description: After good movement on the start, and easy slab section leads you to a tricky face crux with a cool granite pocket and lieback
content.location: Left of Golden Grits, the right of the two sport lines in the center of the crag.

content.description: Start in the corner/gully then step right to climb past bolts. Trend right then up a steep slab.
content.protection: 5 bolts, optional small gear. Bolts and chains.
content.location: At the far right end of the crag. Shares start with Sidesplitter off a small ledge.

content.description: A nice right leaning hand crack leads to a crux near the top.
content.location: This is the crack just left of Flapjacks.

content.description: An akward right leaning hand and fist crack leads to a wider section up top.  Finish to the anchors visible to the right.
content.protection: Gear to 3,5" Doubles in the larger sizes.  Bolted rap station.
content.location: On the far right side of the crag, starting behind the tree.

content.description: Left of the 2 bolt anchor head up the slab past a bolt to the right side of a large overhanging flake.  Yard up the flake past a bolt to the airy crack which leads to easier climbing above.
A leaning 2" Crack on the left side of the Crag,  For the leader the leaning nature of the crack and sparse right feet are challenging, if you don't need to look at your cams it's a walk.
content.protection:
Pro to Camalot 1, shares anchors with

Clean White Bright Light of Forgiveness
content.location: Far left crack on the upper 'buttress'

climbs.name: The Clean White Bright Light of Forgiveness

content.description: At certain points on this friction slab the holds are nearly nonexistent.  Expect tenuous moves above the first and third bolts, with captivating and sometimes bewildering movement.  For anyone unfamiliar with the climbing style this route is depressingly stout.
content.protection: 4 bolts, you could place some pro when you meet Crack du Jour but you probably have it in the bag
content.location: Right of Crack du Jour and shares the same anchors, totally worth TR'ing if your not feeling up for the lead.

content.description: Slab climbing up a short face leads to a crux two thirds of the way up.
content.location: Right side of the clean slab to the right of the main buttress.  The 1st route encountered.

content.description: Pure friction climbing with the crux just below the 2nd bolt leads to easier but sustained climbing to the anchors.
Tier directly below Dollars for Donuts
content.protection: 6 bolts, some cams for the start, and traverse
